p.s: The exceptexcerpt of the drama A Raisin in the Sun is about Walter Youngers' dream and Ruth's opinion about his dream.
Walter's dream would be financed by the paycheck the family getgets for Mama's husband's death.
Firstly you can say that Walter's dream is to open a liquor store with his friends Willy Harris and Bobo.
But the liquor store is not his actual dream.
His actual dream is to be, as the only man in the household besides Travis, who is a little boy, the one who earns the most money and carrycarries for the family.

I'm thirty-five years old; I been married eleven years and I got a boy who sleeps in the living room [...] and all I got to give him is stories about how rich white people live ...(l. 40-43) this shows how ashamed Walter is for being poor and not being able to get his family a better life.

Also in the example you can see that he blames only himself for having such a bad life and no one other from the family because he thinks that he is the man so he is the only one who can better the family's life.
Secondly, Walter is convinced with the idea that women do not understand how the world works and that men are way more intelligent.
This you can see in the phrase: See there, that just goes to show you what women understand about the world (ll. 32).
Furthermore you can see that Ruth is against the idea of opening a liquor store but does not really try to convince him to not open a liquor store because she is too tired for such a big discussion.
This you can see in her short answers.
She never speaks more than two sentences.

Also the phrase: Eat your eggs, they gonna be cold (l. 34) is a very important phrase from Ruth because it again shows that she does not want to have a big discussion with Walter and just wants to change topics.
But is also is important because with this response she indirectly telltells Walter that she does not like the idea of opening a liquor store and does not support his dream.
Compared to the others' dreams Walter's dream is a bit selfish.
The dream of Mama and Ruth is to buy a bigger house.
The dream of Travis is having better living conditions so his dream is like the dream of Ruth and Mama.
And the dream of Beneatha is to finance her medicine study, which is also a bit selfish.
Walter's dream is selfish because it is a high risk he takes, only to be the one, carrying for the family.
Also if the liquor store does not work very well he would looselose all of the money the family got to better their life.
So all in all you can say that Walter is very convinced with his dream but the conversation with Ruth shows that Ruth thinks that a liquor store is a bad idea.
Also Walter has a picture in his head where the man is the one who carries for his family and not a woman.
